item.title: The Testing phase
item.description: Software testing, at its core, is an activity where software undergoes various forms of evaluation. It’s conducted to ensure that the software adheres to specified requirements and doesn’t demonstrate unwanted behaviours1. It is a meticulous blend of logic and creativity: logic to methodically navigate predefined paths and creativity to anticipate unexpected scenarios and user behaviours. Before diving into its components, let’s recognize the non-negotiable importance of testing in the SDLC.
